Class DataReader

java.lang.Object
SystemEnvironment.DataReader
public class DataReader extends Object
Reads simulator configuration from XML and builds an in-memory DataSetting.

This reader supports two root document types:

  • workload – parses tasks, critical sections and shared resources from a workload.xml and populates the TaskSet (integrating attributes such as baseSpeed, utilization ratios and critical-section ratios);
  • processor – parses the processor model, DVFS type, available core speeds and the power-consumption function and creates CoreSets and cores under the Processor.

The original inline comments have been integrated: you can either edit the XML to change task properties or read them to instantiate tasks; critical sections and shared resources are wired accordingly; for a processor file the DVFS type controls whether a per-core CoreSet is created.

Author:
ShiuJia, mingfa

  • Constructor Details

    • DataReader

      public DataReader()
      Creates a new reader with an empty DataSetting container that will be populated after calling loadSource(String).

  • Method Details

    • loadSource

      public void loadSource(String sourcePath) throws org.dom4j.DocumentException
      Loads and parses an XML source file, then builds the corresponding data structures into this reader's DataSetting.

      Behavior depends on the XML root element name:

      • workload: creates tasks (including optional priority/criticality variants), critical sections and shared resources;
      • processor: creates the processor model, core sets, available speeds and power-consumption function, honoring the configured DVFS type;
      • otherwise: prints a warning that the source is not supported.
      Parameters:
      sourcePath - path to the XML file (absolute or resolvable by dom4j)
      Throws:
      org.dom4j.DocumentException - if the file cannot be read or the XML cannot be parsed

    • convertElementsToLongList

      public List<Long> convertElementsToLongList(List<org.dom4j.Element> elements)
      Converts a list of DOM elements to a list of longs.

      Each element's trimmed text content is parsed as a long. If the input list is null or empty, an empty list is returned. When a value cannot be parsed, an error message is printed to System.err and a default value 0L is inserted at that position.

      Parameters:
      elements - list of Element whose text values should be converted
      Returns:
      a list of parsed Long values (possibly empty, never null)

    • getDataSetting

      public DataSetting getDataSetting()
      Returns the fully built DataSetting after a successful call to loadSource(String). The returned object contains the parsed processor configuration and/or workload definition, depending on the input file.
      Returns:
      the current DataSetting instance (never null)
